element.name: TPosition
element.short: Represents the Position and Size on Screen of an Form
element.descr:
poDesigned - The Form appears exactly as it is positioned and sized in the Form Designer
poDefault - The window manager decides how the form is to appear, in a default position and size
poDefaultPosOnly - keeps the Designed size, but position determined by windowmanager
poDefaultSizeOnly - keeps the Designed position, but size determined by windowmanager
poScreenCenter - Centers the form on screen
poDeskTopCenter - Centers the form on desktop
poMainFormCenter - Centers the Form on the Main Form
poOwnerFormCenter - Centers the Form on Owner form

element.name: TWindowState
element.short: Represents the actual State of the window on the screen
element.descr:
wsNormal - The window appears normal
wsMinimized - The window appears minimized
wsMaximized - The window appears maximized

element.name: EScrollBar
element.short: Exception in Scroll Bar
element.descr: Exception class for Scroll Bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar
element.short: Control Scroll Bar
element.descr:
Control Scroll Bar: Scroll Bar control for adding to windows. Can be horizontal or vertical.
This is an ancestor class for many form types and classes of windowed controls

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create
element.short: Create an instance of a Scroll Bar Control

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create.AControl
element.short: The identity of the windowed control in which the scroll bar is found

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Create.AKind
element.short: Whether this is a horizontal or a vertical scrollbar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Assign
element.short: Finds some properties of the control bar from the source control
element.descr: Assigns the contents of the source object to the current object; in particular finds the increment, position, range and whether smooth scrolling is to be feature and whether the scroll bar is visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Assign.Source
element.short: The object that called this instance of the class

element.name: TControlScrollBar.IsScrollBarVisible
element.short: Visibility of scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.IsScrollBarVisible.Result
element.short: Returns 'True' if scroll bar visible

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollPos
element.short: Position of the indicator cursor on the scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ScrollPos.Result
element.short: Returns position of the scroll cursor as an integer

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Kind
element.short: Finds which kind of scroll bar this is: horizontal or vertical
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine which kind of scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar
element.short: Finds out details of the other scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns a link to the details of the other scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetHorzScrollBar
element.short: Find out details about the horizontal scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetHorzScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns details of the horizontal scroll bar as a pointer to a structure

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVertScrollBar
element.short: Find out details of the vertical scroll bar

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetVertScrollBar.Result
element.short: Returns details of the vertical scroll bar as a pointer to a structure

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Size
element.short: Determine the size of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the size; by default the size is not stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Increment
element.short: The size of the scrolling increment
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the triangle at either end of the bar is selected.
Read or write a flag to determine the increment, an integer with a default value of 8 (pixels)

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Page
element.short: The size of the paging increment for scrolling
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the cursor selects the scroll bar above, below or on either side of the scroll indicator.
Reads or writes a flag to determine paging increment; default value is 80 pixels

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Smooth
element.short: Determine whether smooth scrolling is to be implemented
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine smooth scrolling, and sets a flag is the scrolling status is stored

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Position
element.short: Position of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag with the position; default is zero

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Range
element.short: The range (extent) of the scroll bar
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the range; default is zero

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Visible
element.short: Is the scroll bar visible?
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine visibility, and sets a flag if the property is stored

element.name: TScrollingWinControl
element.short: Scrolling Window Control
element.descr:
Scrolling Window Control: A window control with scroll bars.
An ancestor class for many forms with scrolling windows

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Create
element.short: Create an instance of a scrolling window control
element.descr: This constructor can override the constructor of an ancestor class

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Create.AOwner
element.short: The component that owns the scolling window control

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.Destroy
element.short: DEstroy this instance of scrolling window control, and free its resources
element.descr: Can override destructor of parent class

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.UpdateScrollbars
element.short: Update the position of the scroll indicatores in the scroll bars

element.name: TScrollingWinControl.AutoScroll
element.short: Does auto-scrolling apply?
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine auto-scrolling

element.name: TScrollBox
element.short: Scroll Box
element.descr: Scroll Box: A box with scroll bars

element.name: TCustomFrame
element.short: Custom Frame
element.descr: Custom Frame: The base type for Frame

element.name: TFrame
element.short: Frame
element.descr: Frame - a container for all the other components on a form, or for a group of components within a form

element.name: TBorderIcon
element.short: Specifies which icon appears on the top border of the Form
element.descr:
biSystemMenu - The form has a System menu (Maybe not all windowmanager supports this)
biMinimize - The form has an minimize button
biMaximize - The form has a maximize button
biHelp - When you click this button a Question Cursor appears and the help routines are called if you click on an control

element.name: TCustomForm
element.short: Custom Form
element.descr: Custom Form - the base type for FORM

element.name: TCustomForm.Active
element.short: Is true when the form has the focus
element.descr: Use active to check if the form has the focus

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveControl
element.short: Specifies the active control on the form
element.descr: Use this to get or set the active control on this form

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderIcons
element.short: Specifies which icons appear on the top of the form
element.descr:
Use bordericons flags to get or set the icons that appear on the top border of the form.
By default we see down-triangle or other generic icon on the left,
which activates a pop-up system menu allowing closure or re-sizing of the form,
and on the right end we see the minimise and re-size/maximise buttons,
but of course these can be customised by the application programmer.

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderStyle
element.short: Specifies the appearance of the form's border
element.descr:
Use borderstyle to get or set the appearance of the form's border.
By default it is a sizeable window, but it could, for example, be a dialog form or a tool window, or could be non-sizeable

element.name: TCustomForm.CancelControl
element.short: The control associated with the cancel action
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the control associated with the Cancel action (exit from the control without changing anything).
This is usually a button with the caption 'Cancel', but might be an 'Exit' button or anything else the application programmer decides..
This control is selected either by explicitly clicking with the mouse, or by hitting the 'Esc' key

element.name: TCustomForm.Color
element.short: The colour of the form
element.descr: The form's colour; by default it is the same as the colour specified for button faces.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefaultControl
element.short: The control associated with the default action for this form
element.descr:
Reads or sets a flag determining the default control.
This is typically a button such as 'Accept' which is highlighted in some way on-screen to indicate that this is the default action, and is selected either by hitting 'Return' or 'Enter' or by selecting that control with the mouse

element.name: TCustomForm.FormState
element.short: Determines the state of the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the form's state:
is it being created, is this its first showing, is the border style being changed, etc.
FormState is a set, so could take zero or more of possible values.

element.name: TCustomForm.FormStyle
element.short: Determinates the style of the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes flag to determine the style of the form.
Default is 'normal', but could be MDIChild or MDINormal,
could stay on top or could be a 'Splash' form.
FormStyle is a set, could take zero or more of these values.

element.name: TCustomForm.HelpFile
element.short: Specifies the help file that is used by the form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine identity of Help file,
and to determine whether its name is stored.
Property contains filename as a string.

element.name: TCustomForm.Menu
element.short: Specifies a MainMenu for this form
element.descr: Drop a TMainMenu on the form and select it here to show it on the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.ModalResult
element.short: Specifies the return value of an modal form
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine whether there is a modal resut.
If the form is modal, returns an integer value.

element.name: TCustomForm.PixelsPerInch
element.short: The scaling of the form in proportion to the screen resolution
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the scaling factor (a longinteger).
Not normally stored locally

element.name: TCustomForm.Position
element.short: The position of the form on the screen
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine screen position of form.
By default it is in the position that it was placed in the Form Designer

element.name: TCustomForm.Visible
element.short: Indicates if the form is visible
element.descr: Set or get this to set the form visible/hidden or get the status of the form

element.name: TCustomForm.WindowState
element.short: Represents how the form appears on the screen
element.descr:
Reads or write flag to determine state of the window on screen.
Default is 'normal' (ie not minimised or maximised)

element.name: TForm
element.short: Form
element.descr:
Form - the fundamental visual object that appears in every GUI application.
Most of the properties are inherited from the ancestors

element.name: TForm.ActiveControl
element.short: Specifies the control that has the focus on the form
element.descr: Use active control to set or get the control that has the focus on this form

element.name: THintWindow
element.short: Hint Window
element.descr: Hint Window - the popup box containing helpful information that appears when the mouse pointer hovers over an object

element.name: TScreen
element.short: Screen
element.descr: Screen - the visible area

descr.short: Specifies which style the form border has

element.name: TScreen.Create
element.short: Create an instance of TScreen

element.name: TScreen.Destroy
element.short: Destroy this instance of TScreen

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormIndex
element.short: The Index number of a Custom Form on the screen

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormIndex.Result
element.short: The Index number of the Custom Form, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormIndex.AForm
element.short: The Custom Form to which the Index refers

element.name: TScreen.FormIndex
element.short: The index number of a Form on the Screen

element.name: TScreen.FormIndex.Result
element.short: The index number of the Form, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.FormIndex.AForm
element.short: The Form to which the Index refers

element.name: TScreen.UpdateScreen
element.short: Method for updating screen

element.name: TScreen.ActiveControl
element.short: The identity of the active control on this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the active control

element.name: TScreen.ActiveCustomForm
element.short: The identity of the active Custom Form on this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the active Custom Form

element.name: TScreen.ActiveForm
element.short: The identity of the active Form on this Screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the active Form

element.name: TScreen.Cursor
element.short: The cursor being used in this screen
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the cursor.
This can take any integer value, but there are several pre-determined cursor styles
listed as constants in 'Controls',
and these should be used to define the cursor for the current screen

element.name: TScreen.CustomFormCount
element.short: The number of Custom Forms on this screen
element.descr: Reads flag to determine number of Custom Forms (integer)

element.name: TScreen.FormCount
element.short: The number of Forms on this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the number of Forms (integer)

element.name: TScreen.Forms
element.short: The list of Forms in this Screen

element.name: TScreen.Forms.Index
element.short: Index number of a Form, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.Fonts
element.short: The fonts to be used in this screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the fonts to be used; their names are stored as a list of strings

element.name: TScreen.Height
element.short: The height of the screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine screen height; stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.HintFont
element.short: The font to be used to display hints
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine the font to be used (font name stored as a string)

element.name: TScreen.Width
element.short: The width of the screen
element.descr: Reads flag to determine screen width, stored as an integer

element.name: TScreen.PixelsPerInch
element.short: Scaling factor for displaying graphic information on the screen
element.descr: Reads a flag to determine number of pixels per inch (integer)

element.name: TApplication
element.short: Application - the whole current program, described as an object
element.descr:
Application - the whole current program, described as an object.
Includes useful function MessageBox, a simple dialog

element.name: TApplication.Create
element.short: Create an instance of TApplication
element.descr: This instance of the constructor performs most of the setting up of the environment for the application. The instances of Create that occur in some of the ancestor classes are place holders rather than actual instructions for constructing the object

element.name: TApplication.Create.AOwner
element.short: The Owner object that invoked this instance of TApplication

element.name: TApplication.Destroy
element.short: Destroy this instance of TApplication and free its resources

element.name: TApplication.ControlDestroyed
element.short: Method for dealing with a control that has been destroyed

element.name: TApplication.BringToFront
element.short: Use the selected widget set's method to bring the application's form(s) to the front

element.name: TApplication.CreateForm
element.short: Create Form or any other kind of component
element.descr:
Note: The name is confusing and only kept for Delphi compatibility.
It can actually create any kind of component
Creates a Component instance, sets the pointer to the component variable and loads the component.
If it is a form it will be added to the application's forms list

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall
element.short: Insert a given asynchronous call into the queue

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall.AMethod
element.short: The method to be used for the asynchronous call

element.name: TApplication.QueueAsyncCall.Data
element.short: The data structure used by the asynchronous call method

element.name: TApplication.ExecuteAction
element.short: The method to be used to execute the action associated with the Application
element.descr: This is a function that should be supplied by the application programmer, to override the placeholders declared in ancestor classes

element.name: TApplication.HandleException
element.short: Exception handler - methods to be followed in response to exceptions
element.descr:
Individual exception handler methods should be supplied by the application programmer, to override place-holder entries declared in ancestor classes.
This method checks whether the application is required to halt if an exception occurs, or invokes the appropriate handler.
It also writes details of the exception to the appropriate place for debugging.

element.name: TApplication.HandleMessage
element.short: Process all events according to the method defined for the widget set

element.name: TApplication.CancelHint
element.short: Cancels a request for a hint, if there is no hint timer or no hint to display

element.name: TApplication.HideHint
element.short: Don't display the hint

element.name: TApplication.Icon
element.short: the icon to be associated with this application
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the Icon

element.name: TApplication.Initialize
element.short: Initialize any forms associated with the application
element.descr: Finds the appropriate widget set, reads the application's icon (if any) from the Lazarus Resource file, initialises the screen, and leaves it ready for processing.

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox
element.short: Message Box
element.descr:
Message Box: a useful function to display a message.
The function is used internally to display messages during the handling of Exceptions, but is also available to application programmers as an alternative to some of the message dialogs found in Dialogs.
The function returns an integer value corresponding to the button that was pressed; its value can be determined by reference to the constants [IDOK..IDHELP]
It can be invoked like a procedure call (ie as a 'MessageBox()' statement rather than as a 'Variable := MessageBox()' function call)

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Result
element.short: Result
element.descr:
Result: integer value returned by the function to signify which box was selected
Can be one of the following values:
IDOK
IDCANCEL
IDABORT
IDRETRY
IDIGNORE
IDYES
IDNO
IDCLOSE
IDHELP

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Text
element.short: Text
element.descr: Text: the string that is displayed as a prompt or instruction in the Box;

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Caption
element.short: Caption
element.descr: Caption: the string label at the top of the message box;

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Flags
element.short: Flags
element.descr:
Flags: longint - an integer constructed by adding together various constants to define the contents and behaviour of the box, for example
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE + MR_ICONQUESTION will cause the application to display a query (?) icon in a box with three buttons:
ABORT RETRY IGNORE.
The following button constants are available:
MB_OK
MB_OKCANCEL
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE
MB_YESNOCANCEL
MB_YESNO
MB_RETRYCANCEL
And the following icon constants:
MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONQUESTION
MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONASTERICK
MB_ICONWARNING = MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONERROR = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONSTOP = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONINFORMATION = MB_ICONASTERICK
These constants are declared on the LCLType unit.

element.name: TApplication.Minimize
element.short: Minimise the form using the widget set's method

element.name: TApplication.Run
element.short: the method to be used to make the application execute.
element.descr: This method should be supplied by the application programmer, and should be the main process control procedure for the application

element.name: TApplication.ShowException
element.short: Show any exception that has occurred

element.name: TApplication.ShowException.E
element.short: The exception that is to be displayed

element.name: TApplication.CaptureExceptions
element.short: If exceptions have occurred, find out what they are, ready for processing

element.name: TApplication.Hint
element.short: The hint associated with the main application
element.descr:
A hint is a small pop-up mesage that appears briefly while the mouse hovers over a specified area of the screen. It usually displays useful information about how to use an object or what data should be entered, etc
Reads or writes a flag to determine the hint associated with the application

element.name: TApplication.HintColor
element.short: The colour used to display the hint

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePause
element.short: The delay period after mouse entry before the hint becomes visible

element.name: TApplication.HintPause
element.short: The length of time for which the hint is displayed

element.name: TApplication.Navigation
element.short: Determine how the form is to be navigated
element.descr:
Reads or writes a flag to determine the navigation method:
Is Tab used to move to next control?
Does Enter or Ret activate the default action?
Does Esc perform the cancel action?
Does F1 activate a Help system?
Navigation Options is a set, so can take zero or more of the available values

element.name: TApplication.MainForm
element.short: The Main Form used by the application for process control and for data input/output
element.descr: Reads a flag to get particulars of the main form

element.name: TApplication.Title
element.short: The Title to be displayed in the top border of the Main Window
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the Title string

element.name: TApplicationProperties
element.short: Application Properties
element.descr: Application Properties: The properties of the current application

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Create
element.short: Create an instance of TApplication Properties

element.name: TApplicationProperties.CaptureExceptions
element.short: Determine whether exceptions are being captured
element.descr: Boolean property (true if exceptions are being captured); reads or writes flag to see if they are being captured

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HelpFile
element.short: Determines which file to use for Help
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine name of Help file - name is stored as a string

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Hint
element.short: Determines Hint to be used
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine Hint - stored as a string

element.name: TApplicationProperties.HintColor
element.short: Colour to be used when displaying Hint
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine Hint colour (stored as a TColor integer)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.ShowHint
element.short: Determines whether a hint is to be displayed
element.descr: Read or write flag to determine whether to display hint (stored as boolean, True if hint is to be displayed)

element.name: TApplicationProperties.Title
element.short: Title to be shown in Application's top Border

element.name: TDataModule
element.short: Data Module
element.descr: Data Module: for interfacing to the database
